title: Lowest Investment in ICT
description: In 2023, Nigeria had one of the lowest investments in ICT with private participation, amounting to only $4,920,000.

title: High Maternal Mortality Ratio
description: Nigeria recorded a high maternal mortality ratio of 993 per 100,000 live births in 2023, indicating significant challenges in maternal health.

title: High Prevalence of Communicable Diseases
description: In 2019, 65.21% of deaths in Nigeria were due to communicable diseases and maternal, prenatal, and nutrition conditions.

title: Low Life Expectancy
description: As of 2023, Nigeria had a low life expectancy at birth, with an average of 54.46 years for the total population.

title: Low Female Life Expectancy
description: In 2023, the life expectancy at birth for females in Nigeria was only 54.74 years, one of the lowest globally.

title: Low Prevalence of Tobacco Use
description: In 2022, only 3.3% of adults in Nigeria used tobacco, one of the lowest rates worldwide.

title: Low Prevalence of Tobacco Use Among Males
description: In 2022, the prevalence of tobacco use among male adults in Nigeria was 6.1%, one of the lowest globally.
